pl.tivian.security

Class AuthToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.tivian.security.AuthToken

  • public class AuthToken
extends java.lang.Object

    This class implements Time-Based One-Time Password Algorithm as specified in RFC 6238, RFC 4226 and RFC 2104.

    Supported hash functions:

    • SHA-1
    • MD5

    Currently AuthToken is using Java build-in hash functions. In near future is expected to add support for RIPEMD-128/160.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AuthToken(byte[] secret)
      Creates a new authorization token for given secret stored in byte array.

      Creates a authorization token using provided hash algorithm name.
      AuthToken(byte[] secret, java.lang.String algorithm, int interval)
      Creates a authorization token using provided hash algorithm name and specified interval.
      AuthToken(byte[] secret, java.lang.String algorithm, int interval, int digits)
      Creates a authorization token using provided hash algorithm name, specified interval and desired one-time password length.
      AuthToken(java.lang.String secret)
      Creates a new authorization token for given secret phrase stored in base32 format.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuthToken

        public AuthToken(java.lang.String secret)

        Creates a new authorization token for given secret phrase stored in base32 format.

        Parameters:
        secret - phrase stored in Base32 format

      • AuthToken

        public AuthToken(byte[] secret)

        Creates a new authorization token for given secret stored in byte array.

        Parameters:
        secret - phrase given by authentication provider

      • AuthToken

        public AuthToken(byte[] secret,
                 java.lang.String algorithm)
          throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

        Creates a authorization token using provided hash algorithm name.

        Parameters:
        secret - phrase given by authentication provider
        algorithm - name of algorithm which will be used for this AuthToken (default SHA-1)
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm is not supported

      • AuthToken

        public AuthToken(byte[] secret,
                 java.lang.String algorithm,
                 int interval)
          throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

        Creates a authorization token using provided hash algorithm name and specified interval.

        Parameters:
        secret - phrase given by authentication provider
        algorithm - name of algorithm which will be used for this AuthToken (default SHA-1)
        interval - indicates how often the key change (default 30 seconds)
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm is not supported

      • AuthToken

        public AuthToken(byte[] secret,
                 java.lang.String algorithm,
                 int interval,
                 int digits)
          throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Creates a authorization token using provided hash algorithm name, specified interval and desired one-time password length.

        Parameters:
        secret - phrase given by authentication provider
        algorithm - name of algorithm which will be used for this AuthToken (default SHA-1)
        interval - indicates how often the key change (default 30 seconds)
        digits - length of the output (default 6 digits)
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm is not supported
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given length of the output is outside range of inclusive [6, 8]

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public java.lang.String getKey()

        Get valid key for current timestamp.

        Returns:
        string of time-based one-time password

      • getKey

        public java.lang.String getKey(java.time.Instant timestamp)

        Get valid key for given timestamp.

        Parameters:
        timestamp - corresponding to the time when key supposed to be obtained
        Returns:
        string of time-based one-time password

      • getKey

        public long getKey(long time)

        Get valid key for given time from epoch in seconds.

        Parameters:
        time - given in seconds from Epoch (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z)
        Returns:
        time-based one-time password in form of number
